texto:
Please read these legal terms of use before using the “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” application. 

By using “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS”, you accept and agree to comply with the terms and conditions set out in the “legal terms of use”.

This term is a binding agreement between you and the “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” application, which covers all of your access and use of that application, which includes the use of all information, data, tools, products, services and other content available by middle of this.

By using this application, you confirm that you understand and agree to the following rules:

  1. Respect for Laws :

1.1. The user must access the “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” only for lawful purposes;   

1.2. The user agrees to use the application only for the proper purposes and in accordance with the present term and legal limitations, as well as any applicable policies in Brazil;   

1.3. Access is prohibited in territories where the content is considered illegal. Those who choose to access this site from other locations will do so on their own initiative and will be responsible for compliance with applicable local laws. The materials must not be used or exported in breach of Brazilian law. Any pending issues regarding the materials will be settled by Brazilian law.   

1.4. Unauthorized alteration of the contents of this application is strictly prohibited.   

 

  1. Children and adolescents :

2.1. The use of the application is indicated only for individuals of 12 (twelve) years of age or older, teenagers according to the Statute of the Child and Adolescent, under observation of the parents.   

  1. Responsibility for content:

3.1. “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS ” is not responsible for the content of any information that may be exchanged by users between themselves and between the user and the application , or that for “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS”, whether legal or illegal.   

3.2. The user agrees that he is solely responsible for his own conduct and for the accuracy of the information provided while using the service and that he is responsible for the consequences that result from the intentional provision of incorrect data.   

3.3. The user agrees that when using the “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS”, he / she will not publish, send, distribute or disseminate defamatory, obscene or illegal content or information, including exclusive proprietary information belonging to other people or companies, as well as registered trademarks or information protected by copyright, without the express authorization of the holder of those rights . The user is prohibited from sharing any information or health data of third parties ;                 

3.4. No one can act on your behalf when using “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS”. You are responsible for the content that unauthorized individuals produce when using this application using, with your permission, your registered profile . This rule does not apply to cases of fraud or other application security issues.   

 

  1. Content accessibility:

4.1. The “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” team does not guarantee that this application will be partially or fully functional for use outside the national territory .   

 

  1. Intellectual property:

5.1. The “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” team and its collaborators are the copyright holders of the content produced and presented in this application. This premise does not apply to information considered to be in the public domain or in the public interest.   

5.2. All other trademarks, service marks, names and logos appearing in this application are the property of their respective owners.   

5.3. The application “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” is an open source software whose use by third parties is subject to the terms of the international GNU General Public License , version 3 (GPL-3.0). The rights to use the content and reports generated by the application are assigned by the developers, in particular those resulting from the terms of the Creative Commons - Attribution- Non-Commercial 4.0 International license .   

5.4. Only information released by health services should be considered official for public disclosure, with respect to data related to this topic.   

5.5. The data collected through the “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” may be influenced by its ability to access mobile devices with minimum technological specifications. In this way, the information obtained through this application, may not necessarily correspond to the actual expression of the epidemiological pattern of that period and location, as it depends on the connection and accuracy of the telephone operators' antennas.   

 

  1. Laws, regulations, rights and duties:

6.1. It is the policy of the “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” team to respect data protection rules , comply with all applicable laws and regulations , which may be modified from time to time. In the event that any provision of this Terms of Use conflicts with any applicable law or regulation, the applicable law or regulation will replace the contrary provision.   

6.2. These Terms of Use and the use of “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” respects your privacy and will be adapted to Law 13.709 / 18 LGPD and future regulations of ANPD and will be governed and interpreted in accordance with the internal laws of Brazil, in force, without taking taking into account its conflict-of-law rules. In the event of any conflict between the laws, rules and regulations of foreigners and those of Brazil, the laws, rules and regulations of Brazil shall prevail.   

6.3. The “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” may, but is not obliged, to monitor, review and restrict access to any of its areas where users transmit information, being able to remove from the air or remove access to any of this information or communications.   

6.4. If you have any questions regarding “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS”, do not hesitate to contact us by email :  coe@saude.gov.br .   

 

  1. Use of contributions.

7.1. By submitting a written contribution or posting information on “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS ”, you grant a perpetual, royalty-free and unconditional license for this application to the Ministry of Health.   

7.2. By publishing your contribution in “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS”, you will be contributing to the measures to deal with the public health emergency of international importance resulting from the coronavirus ( http : //j.mp/ coronaLEIquarentena ), in an aggregated form (never individually) to other media, and to discuss or reference it in any scientific and educational publications .   

7.3. You also agree that “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” has the right, but not the obligation, to edit or remove any contribution, or to include it in the text in conjunction with other contributions, at the sole discretion of the team related to that application.   

7.4. All information provided by users or health professionals is protected, in accordance with the General Personal Data Protection Act (LGPD), Law No. 13,709, of August 14, 2018.   

7.5. Second Chapter II (On the processing of personal data), Section II (On the processing of sensitive personal data), Art. 13. In carrying out studies on public health, research bodies may have access to personal databases, which will be treated exclusively within the body and strictly for the purpose of carrying out studies and research and kept in a controlled and safe environment, according to security practices provided for in specific regulations and that include, whenever possible, the anonymization or pseudonymization of the data, as well as consider due ethical standards those related to studies and research.   

 

7.5.1. § 1 The disclosure of the results or any excerpt of the study or research referred to in the caput of this article under no circumstances may reveal personal data.

7.5.2. § 2º The research body will be responsible for the security of the information provided for in the caput of this article, under no circumstances, the transfer of data to a third party.

7.5.3. § 3 The access to data referred to in this article will be subject to regulation by the national authority and health and sanitary authorities, within the scope of their competences.

7.5.4. § 4 For the purposes of this article, pseudonymization is the treatment by which a data loses the possibility of association, directly or indirectly, with an individual, if not through the use of additional information maintained separately by the controller in a controlled and safe environment.

  1. Secrecy and Anonymity Guarantee:

8.1. The confidentiality and anonymity of all information produced by the user in the “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” will be guaranteed , except as required by law , or to deal with non-compliance issues.   

8.2. We reserve the right to use this information internally and, in this context , your contribution will always be linked to the nickname of your choice , replacing the users' personal data .   

8.3. CORONAVÍRUS-SUS, its employees and users, including governmental and non-governmental agencies, depend on users for the accuracy of contributions. The team is not responsible for errors or inaccuracies in any submission. Deliberate misrepresentation of information by a user may constitute a violation of the law, and if serious, it will be reported to the appropriate government authorities.   

 

  1. Update of “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS”:

9.1. M odificações this application and Terms of Use may occur. Unless otherwise indicated, your use of the application indicates full acceptance of the Terms of Use in that version in effect each time you use “CORONAVIRUS-SUS”. Stay tuned for updates and, in case of doubt, the Terms of Use will always be available for access and agreement or not.   

 

  1. Responsibility for actions based on content:

10.1. “CORONAVÍRUS- SUS” assumes no responsibility for any loss and / or damage to people or property, as a result of any use of the ideas , contents, instructions, methods, products or procedures contained in this application.

10.2. Under no circumstances will the professionals involved in the development or management of this application be held responsible for any decision or action taken by you based on such content.  

10.3. In the face of threats or any other risk to your health or integrity always look validated and updated guidelines by the local public health services or ace iff www.saude.gov.br/coronavirus for more information.  

 

  1. Responsibility for technological problems:

11.1. Eventually, all content or any part of the “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” may not be available and may not work correctly at any time. We make reasonable efforts to avoid technological problems, but at any time technological problems of the most diverse nature may occur in these applications, such as viruses, harmful programming routines or problems related to the user's device.

11.2. The application is fornecid the "as is" and "as available" basis . Without limiting our general notice, we do not guarantee the availability, integrity, punctuality, functionality, reliability, sequencing or speed of delivery in that application or any part of the content.

11.3. CORONAVÍRUS-SUS is not responsible for any damage or loss caused by the performance or failure of performance of any or all parts of the application. "CORONAVÍRUS-SUS" is not responsible for any defects, delays or errors resulting from your use of this application.

11.4. The use of all the functionalities of “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” requires availability of internet access by the user, via wifi or data network cable. The absence of this prerequisite can limit the use of the application to its full potential. The “CORONAVÍRU S-SUS” team, considering this notice, does not assume responsibility arising from this limitation.

11.5. This disclaimer applies to any and all damages or losses arising from any events, ensured adoc ̧ will of measures Confidential ̧ to , technical and administrative able to protect personal data accesses not allowed and situation ̧ s accidental or illicit of destruic ̧ will , loss, alterac ̧ will , communication ̧ will or any form of inappropriate or treating illegal , including those caused by any failure of performance, error, omission, interruption tion, deletion, defect, delay in operation or transmission , computer virus, line failure, theft, destruction or unauthorized access, alteration or use of any property, whether for breach of contract, unlawful behavior, negligence or any other cause of action.

 

  1. Responsibility for third party information:

12.1. The provision through the application of links and references to other sites, publications or information resources does not constitute the endorsement of these sites or their resources by “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS”, its agents or representatives.

12.2. The “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” team makes no representations or assertions regarding the quality, content and accuracy of the information, services or products that may be provided by these resources and specifically disclaims any warranties, including, but not limited to, the implied or express merchantability or fitness for any particular use, application or purpose.  

 

  1. Final considerations

13.1. Access to the service represents the express and unrestricted acceptance of the Terms of Use described above. By agreeing to these terms, you grant a perpetual, royalty-free license, unconditional license to the “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS”, Ministry of Health and all successor organizations, to publish your contribution in an aggregated form, never individualized, in the application itself, as well as disseminating them to related public health surveillance services. You also agree that “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” has the right, but not the obligation, to edit or remove any contribution at the sole discretion of the “CORONAVÍRUS-SUS” team.

13.2. This application does not perform clinical diagnosis, it only assists the user in understanding the signs and symptoms related to operational, public health definitions for investigating the coronavirus in his community.

13.3. It is important to note that the case of the composition of signs and symptoms, associated with epidemiological criteria indicates that the user may be a possible case of his chest, this is not a diagnosis. The Ministry of Health advises that the patient should seek care at a health center closest to him for clinical evaluation.
